result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Healy Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------
The defendant is to complete a total of forty (40) hours of community service work, which was completed prior to sentencing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M Healy Jr.

Defendant Kevin M Healy in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Attorney Rebecca Hammock appeared.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin M Healy in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 11-13-15. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Atty Rebecca Hammock has been appointed
Defendant in court with atty Rebecca Hammock. Atty A. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not Guily plea entered. Minutes Filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.L.C. OR HER RESIDENCE. 15-2545, 15-2546, 15-2547, 15-2548
Defendant in court in custody with Atty Hammock for bond purposes only. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.
